solution_line_template: Alex traveled at {flat_speed} miles per hour for {flat_duration} hours, so {flat_speed} * {flat_duration} = <<{flat_speed}*{flat_duration}={flat_distance}>>{flat_distance} miles on flat ground.

He traveled {uphill_speed} miles per hour uphill for {uphill_duration} hours, so {uphill_speed} * {uphill_duration} = <<{uphill_speed}*{uphill_duration}={uphill_distance}>>{uphill_distance} miles uphill.

He traveled downhill {downhill_speed} miles per hour for {downhill_duration} hours = {downhill_speed} * {downhill_duration} = <<{downhill_speed}*{downhill_duration}={downhill_distance}>>{downhill_distance} miles downhill.

Before his tire punctured, he traveled {flat_distance} + {uphill_distance} + {downhill_distance} = <<{flat_distance}+{uphill_distance}+{downhill_distance}={total_biked_distance}>>{total_biked_distance} miles.

So as the next town is {total_trip_distance} miles from where he began, Alex had to walk for {total_trip_distance} - {total_biked_distance} = <<{total_trip_distance}-{total_biked_distance}={walk_distance}>>{walk_distance} miles.
